summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) documenting a voluntary interview conducted on August 5, 2021, with a Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) employee from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The memorandum lists attachments including the interview transcript and various MCC records from August 9-10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation into his death while housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. He is identified by his register number 76318-054.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Employee
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary interview of a Federal Bureau of Prisons employee from MCC New York regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: MCC New York Records Date
events.description: Multiple MCC New York records (Daily Assignment Roster, Lieutenant's Log, Count documentation, email) were generated on this date, one day before Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: MCC New York Records Date
events.description: Multiple MCC New York records (Daily Assignment Roster, Lieutenant's Log, Count documentation) were generated on this date, the day of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
Boston Area Office (likely location of OIG interview)
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted an interview on August 5, 2021, with a BOP employee from MCC New York as part of its investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The memorandum references and attaches numerous MCC New York records from August 9-10, 2019, including assignment rosters, logs, count sheets, and an email.
Jeffrey Epstein's BOP register number is listed as 76318-054.
The document explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the Inspector General and is for internal agency distribution only.
The identities of the interviewed BOP employee and the OIG agents are redacted in the provided text.
